summary: The 'Kids Off Social Media Act' (S. 278) aims to protect children and teens online. Title I prohibits social media platforms from allowing users under 13 and restricts personalized recommendation systems for those under 17.  It defines key terms like 'social media platform' and outlines enforcement by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and state attorneys general. Title II, the 'Eyes on the Board Act of 2025,' amends the Children's Internet Protection Act to include social media platforms, requiring schools to enforce policies preventing student access and implement technology protection measures. Title III addresses severability.
